intro: Syngonanthus vareschii, commonly known as the Florida flame flower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular red flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in wetland habitats, such as marshes and swamps, and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. It has opposite, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Syngonanthus vareschii is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to brackish water conditions.
